subject: Tank Leasing Request
body:
Dear Jeanne,

  Thanks for your email. Kindly know that the Letter Of Intent LOI, 
should consist of your storage requirement and company details. With 
submission of your LOI, the TSA would be drafted and issued to your 
company.

Our leasing terms are comfortable and price rental rates are good. We 
also give discount rates, when booking for a longer duration.

Initial payments for TSA activations/reservations are done by lessee 
management to our nominated bank account details as drafted by our 
finance unit. Once TSA is signed by all parties, the 
Activation/Reservation process would have to be done by Lessee, to 
enable tank spaces assigned to them.

Cancellation of storage agreement is rights to the lessee management, if 
they decide not to make use of their reserved tank space. This also 
relates to our Refund policy, which are clearly stated in our Tank 
Storage Agreements documents.

Refund of payments will be done by our finance unit, after receiving 
confirmation notice from Lessee management. Cancellation under the 
signed TSA, amount no penalties or fees.

Do submit your LOI to proceed.
Best Regards,

Mr. David Phillipson
Manager (Storage)
+1-432-268-8837 WhatsApp
On Behalf of DIAMOND A TANK FARM LLC









-- 
DIAMOND A TANK FARM LLC

subject: Re: Tank Leasing Request
body:
Hello Mr. David Phillipson,

Thank you for your detailed response. I appreciate the information about the Letter Of Intent (LOI) and the Tank Storage Agreements (TSA). It's great to hear that your leasing terms and rental rates are good, and that discounts are available for longer bookings.

Could you please clarify a few things for me? When you mention that initial payments for TSA are done by lessee management to your nominated bank account, could you explain how this process works? Also, what does the activation process involve?

Regarding the refund policy, it's reassuring to know that refunds will be handled by your finance unit without penalties or fees. Could you provide more details on how this process is carried out?

Lastly, could you guide me on how to submit my LOI? Is there a specific format or any particular details I need to include?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Jeanne

subject: Re: Tank Leasing Request
body:
Dear Jeanne,

  Thanks for your mail, it was well received.

For clarification and answers to your questions, below are answers.

1. Initial Payments are done by lessee management, for the activation of 
their TSA and having tank reservation with us. This will enable us to 
issue a valid Tank Storage Receipt TSR, with details of the tank space 
assigned to your company. Initial number of days in accordance with TSA 
issuance is between 3-6 days of reservation.

2. We are very committed to our refund policy as in TSA. Once lessee 
decides not to make use of the reserved tank space, the refund of tank 
fees payment would be done by our finance unit, upon having the 
confirmation and receiving account details from the Lessee management. 
Receiving your refund notice, it will take our finance unit 72 hours to 
have the refund perfected.

3. Submitting your LOI is very simple. Inform us of the product name and 
quantity to be stored. Also, lessee management is to state their full 
company details, to enable our management draft the official Tank 
Storage Agreement TSA document.

Hope this is well understood.

Do submit your LOI to proceed.
Best Regards,

Mr. David Phillipson
Manager (Storage)
+1-432-268-8837 WhatsApp
On Behalf of DIAMOND A TANK FARM LLC









-- 
DIAMOND A TANK FARM LLC

subject: Re: Tank Leasing Request
body:
Hello Mr. David Phillipson,

Thank you for your detailed response. It's quite enlightening to learn about the process involved in leasing a tank space with DIAMOND TANK FARM LLC.

I'm curious, what is the minimum and maximum quantity of product that can be stored in a single tank? Also, are there any specific products that your tanks cannot accommodate?

In addition, could you please elaborate more on the refund policy? I understand that refunds are made if the lessee decides not to use the reserved tank space, but are there any conditions or penalties attached to this?

Lastly, regarding the submission of LOI, do we need to provide any additional documents along with our company details and product information?

Looking forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Jeanne

subject: Re: Tank Leasing Request
body:
Dear Jeanne,

  Thanks for your reply. We are professional in our logistics services 
and give the best advice to all of our lessee clients.

Our minimum-maximum quantity for Jet A1 Fuel is 500,000 barrels to 5 
Million barrels

For EN590-10PPM is from 50,000 MT to 500,000 MT.

We accommodate all fuel, Petroleum and Crude Oil products.

The only legal penalty is a 15% deduction from the actual tank fees 
paid. Meaning from the paid tank fees, 85% amount would be returned 
without no other conditions.

Regarding the LOI to be submitted, there aren't no additional documents 
included.
Best Regards,

Mr. David Phillipson
Manager (Storage)
+1-432-268-8837 WhatsApp
On Behalf of DIAMOND A TANK FARM LLC





-- 
DIAMOND A TANK FARM LLC

subject: Re: Tank Leasing Request
body:
Hello Mr. David Phillipson,

Thank you for your detailed response. It's great to hear about the range of services that DIAMOND TANK FARM LLC offers, especially in terms of fuel, Petroleum and Crude Oil products.

I'm a bit curious about the quantities you mentioned. Could you please clarify what you mean by barrels to Million barrels for Jet Fuel and MT to MT for EN PPM? I'm not very familiar with these terms.

Also, could you explain a bit more about the legal penalty? I understand it's a deduction from the actual tank fees paid, but how is this amount determined?

Lastly, regarding the LOI submission, are there any specific requirements or guidelines I should be aware of?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Jeanne

subject: Re: Tank Leasing Request
body:
Dear Jeanne,

  Thanks for your mail.

There is nothing to be curious about. For Jet A1 Fuel is measure in 
Barrels, while for the EN590 10PPM is measure in Metric Tons MT.

The deduction is only 15% from the tank fees paid. So, the refunded 
amount would be 85% paid bacl to the lessee management.

We earlier informed you that the LOI should consist of your company 
required products to be stored. Product name and quantity, with your 
company detail info.
Best Regards,

Mr. David Phillipson
Manager (Storage)
+1-432-268-8837 WhatsApp
On Behalf of DIAMOND A TANK FARM LLC








-- 
DIAMOND A TANK FARM LLC

subject: Re: Tank Leasing Request
body:
Hello Mr. David Phillipson,

Thank you so much for your prompt response and the detailed explanation. I appreciate it.

I'm still a bit confused about the measurement units, though. Could you please explain a bit more about why Jet Fuel is measured in barrels and EN PPM in Metric Tons MT? Is there a specific reason for this difference?

Also, regarding the deduction from the tank fees, could you clarify how exactly this process works? How is the refunded amount calculated?

Lastly, concerning the LOI, I understand that it should include our company's required products to be stored along with their names and quantities. However, could you provide some guidance on what kind of detail info about our company should be included?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Jeanne

subject: Re: Tank Leasing Request
body:
Dear Jeanne,

  What product do you want to store in our tank facility? Can we know the 
product name and quantity?

if you are vast in the oil business, you should know the differences in 
the measurement units stated in our earlier email.

The process is very simple, once you pay for tank, you have valid 
receipt. But when you requesting for refund, a 15% amount will be 
deducted from the amount paid, while the balance amount of 85% will be 
credited to your company given account.

The details needed of your company inculdes necessary info from company 
name, and other relevant informations.
Best Regards,

Mr. David Phillipson
Manager (Storage)
+1-432-268-8837 WhatsApp
On Behalf of DIAMOND A TANK FARM LLC




-- 
DIAMOND A TANK FARM LLC

subject: Re: Tank Leasing Request
body:
Hello Mr. David Phillipson,

Thank you for your prompt response and the information provided. I'm not very familiar with the oil business, but I'm eager to learn more about it.

Could you please explain a bit more about the process? What does it mean when you say "once you pay for tank, you have valid receipt"? Also, could you clarify what deductions are made when requesting a refund?

I'm also curious about the units mentioned in your earlier email. Could you provide some additional details on that?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Jeanne

subject: Re: Tank Leasing Request
body:
Dear Jeanne,

  Thanks for your mail.

We simply mean once you pay for the tank reservation booking, you will 
be issued an official Tank Storage Receipt TSR.

A 15% deduction is what will be deducted from the principal amount paid 
for tank space. The remaining 85% will be refunded back to your company.

There is no problem with the measurement unit mentioned in our earlier 
email.

You are to send us your LOI with the product name and quantity to be 
stored. This should be followed with your company details.
Best Regards,

Mr. David Phillipson
Manager (Storage)
+1-432-268-8837 WhatsApp
On Behalf of DIAMOND A TANK FARM LLC








-- 
DIAMOND A TANK FARM LLC

subject: Re: Tank Leasing Request
body:
Hello Mr. David Phillipson,

Thank you for your prompt response and the detailed explanation about the tank booking process. It's quite interesting to learn how things work at DIAMOND TANK FARM LLC.

Just to clarify, when you mention "deduction", does this refer to a certain percentage of the principal amount paid for tank space? If so, could you please provide more details on how this percentage is determined?

Also, regarding the LOI with product name and quantity, would it be possible for you to guide me through the process? I'm not very familiar with these procedures and would appreciate any assistance.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.
